       Introduced by M. of A. THIELE -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Real Property Taxation

       AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to special equal-
         ization  rates for certain school districts and review of final deter-
         minations regarding such special equalization rates

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 3 of section 1230 of the real property tax law,
    2  as  amended by section 54 of part A-1 of chapter 58 of the laws of 2006,
    3  is amended to read as follows:
    4    3. Special equalization rates shall be established for  the  following
    5  school districts:
    6    Amityville union free school district
    7    Brentwood school district
    8    Central Islip school district
    9    EASTPORT-SOUTH MANOR CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT
   10    Freeport union free school district
   11    Hempstead union free school district
   12    RIVERHEAD CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT
   13    Roosevelt union free school district
   14    SAG HARBOR UNION FREE SCHOOL DISTRICT
   15    Tuckahoe union free school district
   16    Uniondale union free school district
   17    Westbury union free school district
   18    Wyandanch school district
   19    S  2. Section 1218 of the real property tax law, as amended by section
   20  18 of part W of chapter 56 of the laws of 2010, is amended  to  read  as
   21  follows:
   22    S 1218. Review of final determinations of state board of real property
   23  tax services relating to state equalization rates. A final determination
   24  of  the  state  board  of  real  property tax services relating to state

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05689-01-1

       A. 2401                             2

    1  equalization rates may be reviewed by commencing an action in the appel-
    2  late division of the supreme court in the  manner  provided  by  article
    3  seventy-eight  of the civil practice law and rules upon application [of]
    4  BY:
    5    (A) the county, city, town or village for which the rate or rates were
    6  established; OR
    7    (B)  THE  CHIEF  EXECUTIVE  OFFICER OR GOVERNING BODY OF ANY MUNICIPAL
    8  CORPORATION CONTAINING A SCHOOL DISTRICT FOR WHICH A  SPECIAL  EQUALIZA-
    9  TION RATE HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED; OR
   10    (C) ANY AGGRIEVED PERSON RESIDING WITHIN A SCHOOL DISTRICT FOR WHICH A
   11  SPECIAL EQUALIZATION RATE HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED.
   12    The  standard  of review in such a proceeding shall be as specified in
   13  subdivision four of section seventy-eight hundred  three  of  the  civil
   14  practice  law  and  rules.  Whenever  a  final order is issued in such a
   15  proceeding directing a revised  state  equalization  rate,  any  county,
   16  village  or  school district that used the former rate in the apportion-
   17  ment of taxes must, upon receipt of such final  order,  recalculate  the
   18  levy  that  used such former rate and credit or debit as appropriate its
   19  constituent municipalities in its next  levy.    Any  special  franchise
   20  assessments  that  were  established  using  the  former rate must, upon
   21  receipt of such final order, be revised by the state board in accordance
   22  with the new rate, and, if taxes have  already  been  levied  upon  such
   23  assessments, the affected special franchise owners shall either automat-
   24  ically  receive  a  refund  if  there  is  a  decrease or be taxed on an
   25  increase in the next levy in the manner provided for omitted parcels  in
   26  title three of article five of this chapter.
   27    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
